concise_definition: v. 指出, 表明, 暗示, 标示

definitions.explanation_en: To point out or make known something clearly, often through a sign, signal, statement, or piece of evidence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过标志、信号、陈述或证据明确地指出或传达某事物。
definitions.example_en: The thermometer indicated a temperature of 38 degrees Celsius.
definitions.example_cn: 温度计显示温度为38摄氏度。

definitions.explanation_en: To suggest or imply something indirectly, without explicitly stating it.
definitions.explanation_cn: 间接地暗示或表明某事，而不明确说出。
definitions.example_en: His hesitation indicated that he was unsure about the plan.
definitions.example_cn: 他的犹豫表明他对这个计划并不确定。

definitions.explanation_en: To direct attention to something, often by pointing, labeling, or marking it.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过指向、标注或标记等方式引导注意力关注某事物。
definitions.example_en: The arrow on the map indicated the location of the nearest hospital.
definitions.example_cn: 地图上的箭头标示了最近的医院位置。

comparison.analysis: “Show” (显示) 更直接、更具体，常指通过视觉或实际呈现来传达信息，如展示照片、数据图表。而 “indicated” 更强调通过间接线索、信号或证据推断出含义，有时带有推理性质。
“Suggest” (暗示) 与 “indicated” 在间接表达含义上接近，但 “suggest” 更弱、更含蓄，常用于推测或可能性；而 “indicated” 通常基于更明确的证据或观察，暗示的确定性更强。
“Signify” (意味着) 更侧重于符号或抽象事物所承载的深层含义，常用于哲学、语言或象征语境。而 “indicated” 更常用于实际情境中，如数据、行为或物理标记所传达的信息，更偏向实用性和可观察性。
